doc.ContractDescription: WE REQUEST NASA ADAP SUPPORT TO INFER THE EVOLUTIONARY STATE, LUMINOSITIES, AND MASSES OF 3,000 STAR-FORMING DENSE MOLECULAR CORES USING HERSCHEL HI-GAL DATA. THE TARGET CORES ARE SELECTED FROM THE 870 M ATLASGAL SURVEY TO HOST THE EARLY STAGES OF HIGH-MASS STAR FORMATION AND TO SPAN THE COMPLETE RANGE OF THEIR EARLY EVOLUTIONARY STAGES. ALL 3,000 OF THESE CORES WILL BE MAPPED IN THE MILLIMETER ASTRONOMY LEGACY TEAM 90 GHZ SURVEY (MALT90), A NEW PROJECT DESIGNED TO SIMULTANEOUSLY IMAGE 16 MOLECULAR LINES NEAR 90 GHZ. THE DUST TEMPERATURES DERIVED FROM THE HI-GAL DATA WILL PROVIDE THE KEY DIAGNOSTIC OF THE EVOLUTIONARY PHASE, AS THE CORES EVOLVE DUE TO HEATING BY THE EMBEDDED YOUNG STARS FROM THE EARLIEST COLD STARLESS CORES, TO INTERMEDIATE TEMPERATURE PROTOSTELLAR CORES, AND FINALLY ON TO HOT CORES AND H II REGIONS. WE WILL CORRELATE THE EVOLUTIONARY STATE INDICATED BY THE HI-GAL DUST TEMPERATURES WITH THE CHEMICAL AND KINEMATIC INFORMATION SUPPLIED BY THE MALT 90 MOLECULAR LINE SURVEY. MOREOVER, SINCE MALT 90 DATA PROVIDES KINEMATIC DISTANCES, THE HI-GAL SUBMM/FIR SPECTRAL ENERGY DISTRIBUTIONS WILL ALSO PROVIDE THE LUMINOSITY AND MASS DISTRIBUTIONS OF DENSE CORES. THIS PROJECT WILL ALLOW FOR THE FIRST TIME A COMPLETE AND ROBUST CHARACTERIZATION OF THE PHYSICAL EVOLUTION OF DENSE CORES. SINCE THIS PROJECT STUDIES THE FORMATION OF HIGH-MASS STARS, IT BEARS DIRECTLY ON NASA'S ORIGINS THEME.

doc.ContractDescription: MODIS DERIVED ALBEDO PRODUCTS HAVE BEEN PRODUCED OVER THE PAST 15 YEARS AND HAVE BEEN EXTENSIVELY VALIDATED AGAINST FIELD MEASURES. THE AVAILABILITY OF THESE OBSERVATIONS FOR OVER A DECADE HAS ALSO PROVIDED A COMPREHENSIVE TEMPORAL RECORD OF VARIATIONS IN THE EARTH'S LAND VEGETATION COVER. AS SUCH THESE DATA SETS ARE USED BY A NUMBER OF CLIMATE, WEATHER, AND HYDROLOGIC MODELING EFFORTS. HOWEVER, FOR USE IN MODELS SUCH AS THE GISS GCM DYNAMIC GLOBAL VEGETATION MODEL, THE ENT DYNAMIC TERRESTRIAL BIOSPHERE MODEL, THIS KEY RADIATION INFORMATION NEEDS TO BE SPECIFICALLY INCORPORATED IN TERMS OF THE PLANT FUNCTIONAL TYPES REPRESENTED WITHIN A PROCESSING GRID CELL. BY CAPTURING THE TRUE VARIABILITY NOT ONLY WITHIN A LATITUDE BAND OR LARGER REGIONAL AREA BUT AT THE 30ARCSECOND SCALE OR BETTER, THESE RADIATION AND VEGETATION COMPONENTS ARE CAPTURED WITH MORE REALISTIC DYNAMICS. THIS EFFORT WILL PROVIDE PLANT FUNCTIONAL TYPE SPECIFIC MEASURES OF ALBEDO AND VEGETATION PARAMETERS ALONG WITH ESTIMATES OF VARIABILITY AND QUALITY.

CHARACTERIZED FETAL BOVINE SERUM 500 ML BOTTLES,CAT#SH30071.03
MOD TO DEOBLIGATE $150 IN SHIPPING FEES.

SULFUR ISOTOPE FRACTIONATIONS RECORDED IN THE ARCHAEAN AND EARLY PALEO-PROTEROZOIC SEDIMENTS DO NOT FOLLOW THE CONVENTIONAL MASS DEPENDENT RELATIONSHIP. OCCURRENCE OF THESE LARGE NON- MASS-DEPENDENT (NMD) ISOTOPE EFFECTS HAS BEEN BROADLY ATTRIBUTED TO THE NMD SULFUR ISOTOPE FRACTIONATION ASSOCIATED WITH SO2 ULTRAVIOLET PHOTOLYSIS, AND THE LATER ABSENCE OF THESE LARGE NMD FRACTIONATION SIGNALS IN SEDIMENTS YOUNGER THAN ~2.45GYR HAS BEEN INTERPRETED TO REFLECT FUNDAMENTAL CHANGES IN THE TERRESTRIAL SULFUR CYCLE AND IS REGARDED AS ONE OF THE MOST CONVINCING PIECES OF EVIDENCE FOR THE OXIDATION OF EARTH S ATMOSPHERE AROUND 2.32-2.45GA. THESE INTERPRETATIONS, HOWEVER, RELY ON OUR UNDERSTANDING OF THE MECHANISM OF NMD SULFUR ISOTOPE FRACTIONATIONS DURING SO2 PHOTOLYSIS, WHICH IS CURRENTLY VERY LIMITED. AS CONTINUING STUDIES REVEAL MORE AND MORE COMPLEXITIES OF NMD SULFUR ISOTOPE ANOMALIES PRESENT IN THE GEOLOGIC RECORDS, OUR INSUFFICIENT UNDERSTANDING ABOUT THE MECHANISMS OF NMD SULFUR ISOTOPE FRACTIONATIONS HAMPERS INFORMED QUANTITATIVE INTERPRETATIONS OF THESE GEOLOGICAL RECORDS. WE PROPOSE TO STUDY THE NON-MASS-DEPENDENT SULFUR ISOTOPE FRACTIONATIONS ASSOCIATED WITH SO2 UV PHOTOLYSIS USING TUNABLE LASER SPECTROSCOPIC METHODS. BUILDING ON THE EXISTING TUNABLE LASER SPECTROSCOPIC METHODS FOR D34S MEASUREMENTS OF SO2, WE PROPOSE TO DEVELOP NEW TUNABLE LASER SPECTROSCOPIC METHODS FOR DETERMINING D34S, D33S AND D36S OF SO2, AND CONCENTRATION, D34S AND D33S OF SO (AN IMPORTANT INTERMEDIATE SPECIES DURING SO2 UV PHOTOLYSIS). WE WILL THEN CONDUCT A SERIES OF BROADBAND LOW PRESSURE (0.01 TO 0.2 TORR) SO2 UV PHOTOLYSIS EXPERIMENTS USING A TWO-CHAMBER CYLINDRICAL PHOTOCELL WITH A DEUTERIUM LAMP. ONE CHAMBER WILL HOST A SHIELDING GAS TO AFFECT THE UV SPECTRUM ENTERING THE OTHER CHAMBER. IN THE OTHER CHAMBER, WE WILL MONITOR, IN REAL-TIME, D34S, D33S AND D36S OF RESIDUAL SO2 AS WELL AS CONCENTRATION, D34S AND D33S OF SO USING TUNABLE LASER SPECTROSCOPY. WE WILL CONDUCT EXPERIMENTS AT SEVERAL DIFFERENT UV WAVELENGTHS, SO2 CONCENTRATIONS, GAS TEMPERATURES, BATH GAS COMPOSITIONS, AND SHIELDING GAS COMPOSITIONS. WE AIM TO SYSTEMATICALLY QUANTIFY THE KEY FACTORS INFLUENCING NON-MASS-DEPENDENT SULFUR ISOTOPE FRACTIONATIONS ASSOCIATED WITH SO2 UV PHOTOLYSIS, AND THUS ADVANCE OUR UNDERSTANDING OF THE EXACT MECHANISM OF SULFUR ISOTOPE FRACTIONATION ASSOCIATED WITH SO2 UV PHOTOLYSIS. THIS PROPOSED STUDY CONSTITUTES NOT ONLY THE FIRST REAL-TIME IN SITU MONITORING OF THE EVOLUTION OF SULFUR ISOTOPE COMPOSITIONS OF SO2, BUT ALSO THE FIRST EXPERIMENTAL STUDY OF THE SULFUR ISOTOPE COMPOSITIONS OF SO DURING SO2 UV PHOTOLYSIS. IN CONJUNCTION WITH EXPERIMENTAL EFFORT, WE WILL ALSO CONSTRUCT QUANTITATIVE MODELS OF PHOTOLYSIS KINETICS TO BETTER INTERPRET THE EXPERIMENTAL RESULTS AND EXTRAPOLATE THEM TO GEOLOGICAL RECORDS. THIS RESEARCH WILL PROVIDE IMPORTANT INSIGHTS ON THE MECHANISM OF NON-MASS-DEPENDENT SULFUR ISOTOPE FRACTIONATION ASSOCIATED WITH SO2 UV PHOTOLYSIS, AND WILL ALLOW US TO QUANTITATIVELY INTERPRET THE VARIATIONS OF THE ISOTOPIC SIGNALS PRESERVED IN THE GEOLOGICAL RECORDS AND TO PUT QUANTITATIVE CONSTRAINTS ON THE EVOLUTION OF OXIDATION STATE OF EARTH S ATMOSPHERE WHICH IS STRONGLY COUPLED TO EARLY BIOLOGICAL EVOLUTION. MOREOVER, THE TLS METHODS FOR MULTIPLE SULFUR ISOTOPE ANALYSES WE PROPOSE TO DEVELOP CAN BE MODIFIED AS FLIGHT INSTRUMENTS TO CHARACTERIZE IN SITU THE SULFUR ISOTOPE COMPOSITIONS OF ATMOSPHERIC GASES AND SOLID SAMPLES ON MARS AND OTHER SOLAR SYSTEM OBJECTS (E.G. VENUS, IO). THEREFORE,THE PROPOSED RESEARCH IS HIGHLY RELEVANT TO RESEARCH EMPHASIS OF NASA EXOBIOLOGY PROGRAM: EARLY EVOLUTION OF LIFE AND BIOSPHERE, AND RESPONSES TO THE OBJECTIVES 2, 4 AND 7 OF ASTROBIOLOGY ROADMAP: MARS AND OUTER SOLAR SYSTEM EXPLORATION, INVESTIGATION OF THE EVOLVING RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN LIFE ON EARTH AND ITS ENVIRONMENT, AND FURTHER DEVELOPMENT OF MULTIPLE SULFUR ISOTOPE COMPOSITIONS AS BIOSIGNATURES.
COST PER TEST INTERFERON GAMA RELEASE ASSAY

doc.ContractDescription: THE IONOSPHERE OF MARS IS A PARTIALLY-IONIZED ATMOSPHERE WITH THE ELECTRON DENSITY AT THE PEAK BEING LESS THAN ONE-MILLIONTH THE NEUTRAL DENSITY. SUCH A SITUATION RESULTS IN THE IONOSPHERE BEING A HIGHLY SENSITIVE SYSTEM RESPONSE FUNCTION TO THE BROAD SPECTRUM OF PHYSICAL PROCESSES THAT CREATE, MODIFY OR REMOVE PLASMA. THESE INCLUDE, IN THEIR MOST GENERAL TERMS, SOLAR-PRODUCTION, CHEMICAL LOSS AND A HOST OF DYNAMICAL MECHANISMS ( PLASMA DIFFUSION, NEUTRAL WIND-INDUCED MOTIONS, AND SOLAR WIND CAPTURE). TO STUDY SUCH EFFECTS USING A SYSTEMS APPROACH HAS NEVER BEEN DONE AT MARS AND MAVEN OBSERVATIONS WILL ALLOW THAT FOR THE FIRST TIME. I HAVE BEEN WORKING ON THE CREATION OF THE FIRST MARS INTERNATIONAL REFERENCE IONOSPHERE (MIRI) SINCE I WAS ASKED TO ADDRESS THAT TOPIC BY A COSPAR WORKING GROUP (MENDILLO ET AL 2004). THIS PROPOSAL DEALS WITH THE USE OF THE PRELIMINARY (UNPUBLISHED) VERSION OF MIRI TO HELP INTERPRET THE FLOW OF MAVEN DATA, AND THEN TO USE MAVEN OBSERVATIONS AS A NEW DATA SOURCE FOR ADVANCING MIRI. MIRI IS A PROJECT CONDUCTED USING UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS VIA RESEARCH INTERNSHIP PROGRAMS AT BOSTON UNIVERSITY, SUPPLEMENTED BY THE OVERSIGHT AND YEAR-TO-YEAR CONTINUITY PROVIDED BY A JUNIOR RESEARCH STAFF MEMBER (MS. CLARA NARVAEZ) IN OUR CENTER FOR SPACE PHYSICS. FOR A GLOBAL MODEL, ONE NEEDS GLOBAL DATA SETS AND THE ONLY ONES APPROACHING THAT COME FROM THE MARS EXPRESS (MEX) MISSION. I HAVE FORMED COLLABORATIONS WITH THE TWO SEPARATE TEAMS THAT COMPRISE THE MARS ADVANCED RADAR FOR SUBSURFACE AND IONOSPHERIC SOUNDING (MARSIS). THE MARSIS ACTIVE IONOSPHERIC SOUNDER (AIS) MODE (GURNETT ET AL 2005) USES RADIO SIGNAL REFLECTIONS TO DETERMINE THE PLASMA FREQUENCIES FOR THE PORTION OF NE(H) PROFILES BETWEEN THE PEAK ELECTRON DENSITY (NMAX) AND THE SATELLITE HEIGHT. WE HAVE WORKED WITH THE UNIVERSITY OF IOWAS TEAM ARCHIVE OF 112,000 NMAX VALUES SPANNING THE YEARS 2005-2012 (PROVIDED BY DRS. GURNETT AND MORGAN). THE SUBSURFACE SOUNDER (SS) MODE IS AN IONOSPHERIC-PENETRATING RADAR (SAFAEINILI ET AL 2003; PICARDI ET AL 2005; MOUGINOT ET AL 2008;) THAT MEASURES RADIOWAVE GROUP PATH DELAY AND THUS THE INTEGRAL OF NE(H), CALLED THE TOTAL ELECTRON CONTENT (TEC). THE INITIAL SET OF MARSIS OBSERVATIONS YIELDED APPROXIMATELY 1.4 MILLION TEC VALUES OVER THE COURSE OF A FULL MARTIAN ORBIT (2005-2007). OUR MARSIS/SS COLLABORATION IS WITH DRS. KOFMAN AND MOUGINOT FROM GENOBLE. IN THIS PROPOSAL, I SHOW HOW WE HAVE USED THESE VAST DATA SETS TO CREATE A FIRST-GENERATION EMPIRICAL MODEL FOR MARS IONOSPHERE. IN ADDITION TO ABSOLUTE VALUES, THE CRUCIAL TOPIC OF VARIABILITY IS ADDRESSED AS A FUNCTION OF SOLAR CONDITIONS, ORBITAL LOCATIONS (SEASONS), DAY-VERSUS-NIGHT, AND MORPHOLOGY OF THE MARTIAN CRUSTAL MAGNETIC FIELDS. DIFFERENT WAYS TO CHARACTERIZE VARIABILITY WERE STUDIED, USING STANDARD DEVIATIONS () OF A DATA BIN MEAN VS. DEPARTURES () FROM A CONTROL CURVE. THE PROGRAM SUGGESTED IS TO MAKE THIS MODEL AVAILABLE TO ALL MAVEN PI TEAMS, TO WORK WITH THEM ON HOW TO INTERPRET INITIAL OBSERVATIONS WITHIN THE CONTEXTS OF KNOWN MAGNITUDES AND VARIABILITY, AND TO ADVANCE MAVEN MISSION PLANS AND GOALS IN A TIMELY FASHION. THEN, WHEN ALL MAVEN DATA SETS ARE FULLY ANALYZED, TO USE THESE AERONOMY SYSTEM RESPONSES TO CREATE JOINTLY THE SECOND GENERATION MIRI.
